item.title: Deploying a python script
item.description: Lately I’ve been writing a lot of python to script some common processes in a large infrastructure. Those scripts require some python libraries which are not part of the standard library nor installed by default in all systems. For example, I love how docopt manages the arguments of a python script, or using the YAML format for my config files instead of INI. During the development stage, I usually manage those dependencies using pip and virtualenv, but I would like my deployment to require only python3 installed in the remote machine.
